## **Specifications Document**

## **Project Details**

| Project Name: | WellSync \- Dalaguete Rural Health Unit Medical Records and Inventory Management System |
| :---- | :---- |
| Date:		 | 10/3/2025 |
| Creator: | HITS Team |
| Version Number: | 1 |

| Project Overview |
| :---- |
| WellSync is a digital platform designed to be the internal inventory and medical record system for the Dalaquete Rural Health Unit. The project aims to replace manual, labor-intensive, and error-prone processes by connecting and automating essential services. The RHU currently faces challenges that impact its ability to deliver optimal services: **Inventory Management** The current process for tracking and counting medicines is manual, labor-intensive, and prone to errors as these are being counted, taken note of and encoded manually which can lead to difficulties in accurate stock counts, managing shelf life, and generating timely reports. The current system relies on manual counting, Excel sheets, and an external system (eLMIS) that is not fully integrated or utilized due to lack of training and outdated data. **Record Archiving** Although they have iClinicSys, it was mentioned by the RHU head that it lacked maintenance and upgrades and they still have a room full of physical folders that are used to store an estimated 70,000 patient medical records and profiles. This manual archiving system makes searching for individual records difficult and time-consuming, and there is a risk of records being lost. **Accreditation and Reporting** The RHU has faced issues with accreditation processes and generating reports for third-party entities like PhilHealth and DOH due to limitations of iclinicsys and a lack of integrated data.  ![][image1] ![][image2] |

| Project Objectives |
| :---- |
| Internal Inventory Management (FIFO \+ FEFO Principle): To automate manual inventory lookups, encoding and computing of received, dispersed, and expired medicines. |
| Digital Record Archiving: To create a secure, searchable digital repository for all patient medical records. |
| Improve Reporting and Data Analytics: By creating an interactive Disease Surveillance and data analysis to support rapid outbreak containment and resource planning. |

| Project Stakeholders |  |  |
| ----- | :---: | ----- |
| **Name/Group** | **Role** | **Responsibility** |
|  **RHU Head** | Module Leaders & Approvers | Provide subject matter expertise, approve applications, review reports, and lead their respective teams during the transition. |
| **RHU Medical Staff and GSO Staff** | System Users | Participate in system design, use the platform for daily tasks (e.g., processing applications, verifying requirements), and provide feedback. |
| **LGU IT Admin** | Technical Support | Manage user access, configure the system, monitor performance, and ensure overall security and data integrity. |
| **Project Owner (Municipality)** | Sponsor / Decision-Maker | Provide funding, set policies, oversee implementation, and ensure project alignment with LGU objectives. |
| **Hatchit Team** | System Developer & Implementer | Design, develop, deploy, and maintain the system; provide training, support, and future upgrades. |

| Technical Approach |
| :---- |
| Direct Integration: DRRMO for health emergencies and coordination (Phase 3\) |
| Indirect Integrations iClinicSys for patient and medical records syncing (accredited to DOH and PhilHealth)  eLMIS for external inventory management system (accredited to DOH) |
| The system will be Cloud-based and accessed via any type of browser such as Chrome, Safari and Edge |

| Project Phases |  |
| ----- | ----- |
| **Phase 1: Foundational Digitalization and Compliance Readiness** |  |
| This phase focuses on eliminating manual record-keeping and stabilizing inventory data. This phase establishes the digital records infrastructure and the critical FIFO/FEFO inventory logic, achieving basic compliance for PhilHealth/DOH reporting via data export. |  |
| **Phase 1 System Overview** |  |
| **Module** | **Features** |
| **Purchasing Management** | Purchase request and PO generation, approval and Lookup, Generation of warehouse receiving report |
| **Inventory Management**  | Barcode/QR scanning, Real-Time Stock Deduction, Manual Input Alternative, Expiry Tracking and Alerts, FIFO/FEFO Logic |
| **Patient Profile & Records Digitization**  | Profile Management, Record Digitization, Active Record Maintenance, Role-Based Access Control, Secure Digital Storage |
| **Core Reporting Module** | Standardized Reporting, Stakeholder Integration, Custom Report Generation and Export |

| Purchase Request |
| :---- |
| This module enables RHU departments (Medical Staff) to formally request medicines and supplies from the GSO or Administrative staff, initiating the procurement process and identifying the requesting unit as a cost center. Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Pending/Approved/Completed PRs PR Creation Interface (Department Lookup) Supplier lookup Item Lookup for faster medicine search Status Tracker (Requested, Approved, Denied, PO Created) Each Purchase Order (PO) Will Include: PR Number PR Date Requesting Cost Center (e.g., Department, Ward, Program) Supplier Details: Supplier Name, Contact Info, Payment Terms, Tax details Created by and Approved by (User-in-charge) Remarks List of Items Requested (Medicine Name, Quantity, Unit) Functionality Details: Request Initiation: Allows Medical Staff or other RHU personnel to digitally request the purchase of medicines or office supplies. Cost Center Identification: Allows the RHU to identify the requesting department (e.g., Ward A, TB Program, or Admin Office) as a separate cost Center for internal tracking and budget allocation. Approval Workflow: Initiates an automated workflow for the RHU Head or GSO/Admin Staff to review, approve, or deny the request. Procurement Linkage: Approved Purchase Requests automatically feed into the Vendor/Supplier Management (Phase 2\) & PO Generation module to streamline the procure-to-pay process. |
| **PO Generation** |
| This feature enables the GSO/Admin staff to formalize and approve medicine reorders, linking them to defined stock thresholds.  Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Pending PO Drafts/History PO Generation Interface (Supplier Selection) Item Lookup for faster medicine search Inventory Check Status (Stock Order, Pending POs) Reorder Items Button (for items below threshold) Each Purchase Order (PO) Will Include: PO Number (Auto-generated) PO Date Supplier Details: Supplier Name, Contact Info, Payment Terms, Tax details Created By and Approved By Remarks List of Items for Purchase (Medicine Name, Quantity, Unit)  |
| **Warehouse Receiving Report (WRR)** |
| This feature formalizes the receiving process and implements Barcode/QR scanning for medicine stock, enforcing the First-In, First-Out (FIFO) confirming that the physical stock scanned matches the approved Purchase Order. This is a one-time event that happens before the stock is active. It ensures a three-way match (PO, Supplier Delivery Receipt, and Physical Scan) for audit and accounting purposes. Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Posted POs available for Receiving WRR Creation Interface (Link to PO and Barcode Scan) Discrepancy Calculator (Scanned vs. PO Quantity) Inventory Addition Confirmation (based on discrepancy calculation) Each Warehouse Receiving Report (WRR) Will Include: WRR Number (Auto-generated) PO Date PO Number Supplier Name  Supplier Number Total Amount Created by Action button: Receive Order PO Number Location Date Received Received By Items (can also be for barcode scanning) Item Ordered quantity Unit Total received quantity Remaining quantity to receive Expiration date Received quantity Remarks  Recent logs Each PO will consist of the ff details (dropdown): Requisition Slip  Expected delivery Approver(s) Supplier Location Date Received and Received By (GSO Staff) List of Items Received  Item Name Quantity Unit Unit Price Discount% Expiry Date Subtotal Discount Total PO Amount Recent logs Remarks Approval process can either be set to  required or bypassed   |
| **Stock Issuance (consignment from one LGU to another)** |
| This module manages the formal transfer of medicine stock from the originating LGU (Dalaguete RHU) to a receiving LGU. It ensures transparency, minimizes waste from expiration, and formally removes the stock from the WellSync inventory for audit purposes. Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Available Expiring Stock (Filtered by Expiry Date) Transfer Out Generation Interface (Recipient LGU Lookup) Real-time Stock Deduction Confirmation Tracking Status (Draft, Approved, Issued, Received) Print/Export Transfer Manifest Discrepancy Log (Transfer vs. Actual Issue) Each Transfer Out Record (TOR) Will Include: TOR Number (Auto-generated) Date of Issuance/Transfer Transferring LGU (Dalaguete RHU) and Receiving LGU (Name, Contact) Approver(s) (RHU Head, Admin) Total Value of Transferred Stock Each Transfer Item Record Will Include (Linked to TOR): Item Details: Item Name, Item Code Batch Information: Batch/Lot Number, Expiration Date, Remaining Shelf Life Quantity: Quantity Transferred, Quantity Requested Source Data: Original PO/WRR Number (for audit trail) Remarks  on the physical condition of the item upon transfer. Functionality Details and Technical Context: Transfer Initiation: Allows GSO/Admin Staff to create a Transfer Out Record (TOR) by selecting a receiving LGU and pulling data from the Expiring Stock Alerts list (from Stock Monitoring Dashboard). Stock Selection (FEFO Principle): The system ensures that only stock nearing expiry (FEFO logic) is eligible for transfer, with preference given to stock closest to the predetermined expiry alert threshold (e.g., less than 6 months). Item Pull/Issuance: GSO Staff uses the Barcode/QR Scanner to scan the specific medicine batches being pulled for transfer. This action immediately deducts the stock from WellSync's active inventory. Transfer Approval Workflow: Requires approval (e.g., from the RHU Head) before the Transfer Out Record can be finalized and the stock physically moved. This ensures accountability. Transfer Manifest Generation: Automatically generates a printable Transfer Manifest (like a delivery receipt) detailing the items, batches, and remaining shelf life for the receiving LGU's acknowledgment. Confirmation Tracking: Includes a field to record the Transfer Status and receive confirmation/acknowledgment from the receiving LGU once the stock is physically delivered.  |
| **Inventory Management Module (Item listings, adjustments and movements)** |
| This module implements Barcode/QR scanning for medicine stock, enforcing the First-Expired, First-Out (FEFO) principle to ensure inventory accuracy and minimize expiration waste. This module is active every day. It handles the medicine's life ***after*** it has been formally added to stock and tracks its movement out of the RHU. Main Screen/Page Displays: Date and Time, Medicine Item Name, Item Sub-Type Medicine Item Name Item sub-type (donated/supplied) Transaction type (Warehouse receiving/Stock Issuance/ Stock Issuance Receiving) Reference Number (WRR/SI/ADJ/SIR) Remarks Received By Expiration Date Beginning Quantity and End Quantity, Quantity Difference Status (Active, Dispersed, Expired) Location (Physical Storage) Action (Disperse, View History, Stock Issuance, Physical Count) Created by Approved by Each Batch Record Includes: Item Name and Unique ID Date Received Batch/Lot Number Expiration Date Current Stock Quantity Supplier/Vendor ID Created by Approved by Functionality Details and Context:  Stock Data Acceptance: Receives confirmed batch data from the WRR module to add stock to the active inventory ledger. Disperse Medicines (First OUT): GSO staff scans the Barcode/QR of the retrieved medicine to automatically deduct stock and provide real-time levels. (This is the *dispensing* scan, distinct from the *receiving* scan). FEFO Logic Integration: The system automatically checks available batches and directs staff to pick the item with the closest expiration date first. Stock Life Cycle: Manages the entire life of the batch: Expired Medicines tracking, Quantity Difference logging, and Status updates. Internal Movement/Audit: Implements all Inventory Actions and Ledger functions (Withdraw, Return, Dispose, Set Physical Count).  |
| **Patient Profile & Records Digitization Module** |
| This module replaces the physical folders by creating a secure, searchable digital repository for all patient information. Main Screen/Page Displays: Patient Unique ID Full Name Date of Birth Registration Status (Active, Inactive) Action (View Profile, Add/Edit Record, Search) Each Patient Profile Includes: Demographic Info (Full Name, Address, Contact) Medical History (Diagnosis and Prescriptions) Medications (Integrated with WellSync Inventory) Appointments Uploaded Documents (Scanned Records, Lab Results) Functionality Details and Technical Context Patient Profile Management \- Creates and manages digital profiles, including demographic and contact information. Medical Records Digitization \- Physical records are scanned and indexed (key data like Patient Name, DOB, Diagnosis are manually entered) to associate them with the digital profile. Staff can add/edit/remove new medical records directly. Data Migration \- The patient profile will use a separate database. Existing patient data from iClinicSys will be imported initially via CSV to avoid double entry, until a direct API integration is possible. (TBD if iClinicSys can generate the necessary Excel file). Advanced Search and Retrieval \- Enables searching by Patient Name, ID number, and Date of Birth, eliminating manual folder searching. Secure Storage and Access \- Implements secure digital storage and role-based access control (e.g., Doctors, Nurses, Admin Staff) to ensure data privacy and compliance. Note: Possible integration with a service like Billbird for:  Fraud Prevention (detecting altered uploaded medical records)  Automated Data Extraction (reading and extracting key data from scanned medical records). |
| **Core Reporting Module** |
| This module ensures key stakeholders can access and export essential data for audit, compliance, and decision-making. Main Screen/Page Displays: Report Type Selection (Inventory, Patient) Custom Report Builder Export Options (Printable, CSV) Stakeholder Integration Status Each Report Will Include: Date Filter (From/To Data Type Selection Inventory: Received, Dispersed, Expired Items Medical Records: Patient Demographics, Record Activity Functionality Details and Technical Context Inventory Management Reports \- Generates reports on inventory activity over specified periods. **Integrated to the Mayor’s office, Accounting, and Treasury Depts.** for general overview and audit. Medical Records Reports \- Generates reports on patient demographics and record activity, filterable by date range. Custom Report Builder \- Allows stakeholders to create custom reports by selecting data type, date range, and format for specific requests. Advanced Search and Retrieval \- Enables searching by Patient Name, ID number, and Date  DOH (iClinicSys/Elmis) Compliance Export \- Reports are printable and exportable to **CSV** format to temporarily support existing DOH accredited systems and GDrive storage (replacing the manual Excel export to eLMIS system). |
| **Phase 1 System Roles and Access**  |
| **Super Admin (RHU Head / IT Lead)** |
| **Portal:** Super Admin Portal **Scope:** Full system-wide access and control. **Capabilities:** User Management: Create, edit, and deactivate user accounts and assign roles.  Configuration: Set system-wide parameters (e.g., Expiry Alert Thresholds, Data Validation Rules).  Full Audit Trail Access: View detailed logs of all user actions. Reporting Integration: Direct integration and report sharing setup (e.g., Mayor's Office, Accounting, Treasury). Procurement Oversight: Full visibility and final approval authority over all Purchase Requests and Purchase Orders. |
| **Admin (RHU Medical and GSO Staff – segmented roles)** |
| **Portal:** Admin Portal**Scope: Admin (RHU Administrative Staff)** Patient Records, General Administration, and Comprehensive Reporting. Accountable for patient registration and generating all necessary internal and external reports. **GSO Staff** Receiving clerk, Purchase request and Order, Internal Inventory Management **Medical Staff** (Doctors, Nurses) Purchase request and Order, Clinical Documentation (R/W) and Patient History Review.  **Role Sub-types (optional): Admin (RHU Administrative Staff)** Patient Profile & Records: Full access to Patient Profile and Medical Records Digitization.  Procurement Initiation: Create, edit, and manage Purchase Requests. Purchasing: Create, edit, and send Purchase Orders (POs) for approval. Reporting: Generate all standard and custom reports.  Inventory (View-Only): View current stock levels. **GSO Staff** Inventory Management: Full use of Barcode/QR Scanning for Disperse Medicines and managing Expired Medicines/Manual Input. Warehouse Receiving: Use the WRR Creation Interface to formally log received medicine shipments against posted POs, including performing the Discrepancy Calculator check.  Procurement (View-Only): View the list of approved Purchase Orders (POs) pending receipt. Patient Profile (View-Only): Access necessary patient identifiers.  Inventory Reporting: Generate standard inventory reports. **Medical Staff** (Doctors, Nurses) Procurement Initiation: Create, edit, and submit Purchase Requests for necessary supplies/medicines. Medical Records: Access, review, and update Medical History and Appointments. Medical Records Digitization: Provide functionality to add/edit/remove new medical records and updates directly into the digital profile. Advanced Search and Retrieval: Full patient record search capabilities.  Inventory: View current medicine stock levels to ensure prescription availability. |

| Phase 2: Workflow Automation and Public Health Intelligence |  |
| ----- | ----- |
| This phase aims to streamline the supply chain and launch proactive public health intelligence. This will automate the complete reordering and stock management lifecycle while introducing real-time disease mapping to transform patient data into immediate action for community health planning and resource forecasting. |  |
| **Phase 2 System Overview** |  |
| **Module** | **Features** |
| **Stock Monitoring and Alerts Dashboard** | Overview of current stock levels Automated alerts, Reordering prompt   |
| **Inventory Actions and Ledger** | View Overall Inventory Status, Set actions: Withdraw, Dispose, Set Physical Count, Inventory Ledger |
| **Vendor/Supplier Management & PO Generation** | Automated draft purchase orders, GSO/Admin Staff approval, Contact and information, Historical data for PO generation.  |
| **Interactive Disease Surveillance Dashboard** | Geographic Disease Mapping, Trend Monitoring Graphs, Real-Time Data Filtering Options, Alerting and Notification Log, Data Filtering Results, Resource Forecasting Estimates  |

| Stock Monitoring and Alerts Dashboard |
| :---- |
| This module provides an overview of current stock levels. Automated alerts are triggered for expiry (e.g., 90 days, 6 months, 12 months) and low stock levels to prompt reordering. Main Screen/Page Displays: Overall Stock Health Overview List of Expiring/Low Stock Items Reorder Recommendations Each Batch Record Includes: Alerts: Item Name, Batch/Lot No., Expiry Date/Low Stock (FEFO prompt) Thresholds: Configurable for expiry (e.g., 90/180/360 days) and low stock levels   |
| **Inventory Actions and Ledger** |
| This module provides a comprehensive view and control over all item movements. Main Screen/Page Displays: Inventory Ledger (Product movements per item) Overall Inventory Status (Low, Expiring, Normal) Action Buttons (Withdraw, Dispose, Set Physical Count) Admin Confirmation Tracker (for sensitive actions) Each Batch Record Includes: Item Code and Name Movement Type (Withdraw, Return, Dispose, Physical Count) Date and Time of Action Quantity Change (+/-) User-in-charge Reference Document (e.g., WRR Number, Prescription ID) |
| **Vendor/Supplier Management** |
| This module manages the approved suppliers for medicines and supplies, providing the necessary contact information, pricing, and historical data for PO generation. Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Approved Vendors/Suppliers Vendor Search/Filter Function Vendor Profile Creation/Edit Interface Historical Purchasing Data (Link to PO History) Each Supplier Profile Will Include: Vendor Details: Supplier Name, Contact Info, Payment Terms Supplier Code (Auto-generated) TIN Number Tax Type (VAT or Non-VAT) Withholding Tax Percentages Medicine Pricing: Unit Cost, Package Cost  |
| **Interactive Disease Surveillance Dashboard** |
| This module transforms patient health data into actionable public health intelligence using geospatial visualization and real-time analysis to enable rapid outbreak investigation and resource forecasting. Main Screen/Page Displays: Geographic Disease Mapping (Hotspot Visualization) Trend Monitoring Graphs (Case Counts over Time) Real-Time Data Filtering Options (Disease, Date Range, Age/Gender) Alerting and Notification Log Data Filtering Results (Case List) Resource Forecasting Estimates (e.g., medication stock needs) Each Alert Record Will Include: Alert Type (e.g., Outbreak, High Risk) Disease Trigger (e.g., Dengue, TB) Location of Outbreak (Barangay/Zone) Recommended Action/Status (Pending, Acknowledged) Date and Time of Trigger Functionality Details: Disease Mapping: Uses patient location data to visually plot cases on a map, quickly identifying outbreak areas or neighborhoods requiring immediate intervention and resource allocation. Trend Monitoring: Tracks the speed and severity of a disease's spread via graphical representation, helping to forecast resource needs (e.g., medication stock).A Alerting and Notification: Prompts immediate action from the RHU Head (Ms. Marisa) or Medical Staff to contain a potential outbreak when case counts exceed predefined thresholds. Real-Time Data Filtering & Analysis: Allows users (Doctors, Ms. Marisa) to filter case data instantly by criteria such as disease (e.g., Dengue, TB), date range, age group, and gender to enable rapid epidemiological investigation to understand who is affected, where, and when. Note: The data for the Interactive Disease Surveillance Dashboard will be sourced directly from the WellSync Patient Profile (which includes diagnosis, demographic, and location data). With the assumption that patient encounters and diagnoses are logged into WellSync.     |
| **Phase 2 System Roles and Access**  |
| **Super Admin (RHU Head / IT Lead)** |
| **Portal:** Super Admin Portal **Scope:** Process Governance & Public Health Oversight **Capabilities:** All Phase 1 Capabilities (Full Audit, User Management, Global Configuration). Alert Configuration: Set and modify alert thresholds for stock expiry and low levels (e.g., 90/180/360 days). Vendor Management Oversight: Manage and approve the master list of approved Vendors/Suppliers and their associated pricing. Public Health Control: Receive and manage Alerting and Notification for potential disease outbreaks. |
| **Admin (RHU Medical and GSO Staff – segmented roles)** |
| **Portal:** Admin Portal**Scope:** Task-oriented Read/Write access to automate workflows and utilize public health intelligence tools.**Role Sub-types (optional):** Medical Staff (Doctors/Nurses) Disease Surveillance: Use Real-Time Data Filtering & Analysis for epidemiological insights. GSO Staff Stock Monitoring: View Overall Stock Health Overview and receive Expiry/Low Stock Alerts.   PO Management: Review and approve draft Purchase Orders (POs) generated by the system. Administrative Staff Vendor Management: Manage Vendor/Supplier contact info and approve draft POs alongside GSO Staff.  |

| Phase 3: Workflow Automation and Public Health Intelligence |  |
| ----- | ----- |
| This phase aims to maximize staff efficiency and patient safety and automate the full cycle from consultation to reordering. This phase is also dedicated to establishing full compliance and integration with key external partners (DOH, PhilHealth, Urbanwatch), enabling advanced service delivery through Mobile and Telemedicine capabilities. It will finalize the shift to a fully connected, accredited, and patient-accessible system |  |
| **Phase 3 System Overview** |  |
| **Module** | **Features** |
| **PhilHealth Claims Processing** | E-Signatures, Status tracking, Patient Lookup, Log/History, Generates ready-to-Submit PhilHealth Claim Forms, Validate claims against PhilHealth rules |
| **DOH/eLMIS API Integration** | API Integration Status, Syncing required report data to DOH-accredited systems (like eLMIS).  |
| **Urbanwatch Integration** | Emergency and Disease surveillance dashboard, summarized medication stock, patient data, location for disaster coordination |
| **Clinic workflow automation** | Book, Reschedule, Manage patient appointments, Generate digital prescriptions/lab orders, Automated checks for patient drug allergies and drug interactions |
| **DOH Program Forms/Templates** | Custom Report Generation and Export |
| **Insurance Policy Integration** | Policy/Member Eligibility Checks for custom insurance, Claims reimbursement, Co-Payment/Billing Estimation |

| PhilHealth Claims Processing |
| :---- |
| This module generates standardized, ready-to-submit PhilHealth claim forms using data captured during consultation and integrates digital signatures. Main Screen/Page Displays: List of Pending Claims (Filtered by Date/Status) Claim Generation Interface (Patient Lookup) Claims Submission Log/History Validation Status (Passed/Failed Internal Check)  Print/Export Claim Form Interface Each Claim Record Will Include: Patient ID, Member Status, and Eligibility Details Service Details (Diagnosis, Procedures/Services Rendered) Digital/Electronic Signature of Attending Physician Required Attachments Checklist/Status Date of Service and Claim Submission Date  |
| **DOH/eLMIS API Integration** |
| This module focuses on eliminating manual reporting by automating data transfer to DOH-accredited systems (like eLMIS) via an API. Main Screen/Page Displays: API Integration Status (Connected/Disconnected) Data Sync Schedule/History Error Log/Pending Resubmission List Manual Trigger/Force Sync Button Each Data Submission Record Includes: Submission Date and Time Data Sent (e.g., Inventory, Service Reports) Receiving System Confirmation (eLMIS Acknowledgment) Report Period Covered  |
| **Urbanwatch Integration (DRRMO)** |
| This module provides an interface for emergency coordination by synthesizing health and inventory data for external disaster management partners (other LGUs). Main Screen/Page Displays: Real-time Emergency Dashboard View Location Data from Surveillance Dashboard Disaster Type Selection/Filter Report Generation for DRRMO  Each Emergency Report Includes: Available Medication Stock Summary (Critical Items) Affected Patients Summary (Count, Primary Diagnosis) Location Data from Interactive Disease Surveillance Dashboard RHU Contact/Coordination Details  |
| **E-Prescribing & Order Entry Interface** |
| This module will generate digital prescriptions/lab orders with automated checks for patient drug allergies and drug interactions. Main Screen/Page Displays: Patient Search/Selection Allergy/Interaction Check Alerts Consultation Summary Each Batch Record Includes: Prescription: Patient ID, Doctor ID, Medicine Name, Dosage, Frequency, Duration Order: Patient ID, Doctor ID, Lab Test/Service, Justification  |
| **Appointment Scheduling Calendar** |
| This module will allow Admin Staff to book, reschedule, and manage patient appointments directly within the system. Main Screen/Page Displays: Daily/Weekly/Monthly View Appointment Search/Filter Each Batch Record Includes: Appointment Record: Patient ID, Doctor/Nurse ID, Date, Time, Reason, Status (Scheduled, Completed, Cancelled) Patient Contact Details: For reminders/rescheduling |
| **Customized Insurance Policy Integration** |
| This module streamlines the verification of patient eligibility and facilitates accurate cost estimation for services covered by a custom, non-PhilHealth insurance provider (TBD). Main Screen/Page Displays: Policy Status (Active/Inactive) Eligibility Check Interface (Member ID Input) Coverage Limitations Summary (e.g., Visits/Year) Co-Payment/Billing Estimation Display Estimated Patient Due Amount Quick Access to E-Prescribing/Order Entry Each Batch Record Includes: Insurance Member ID  **Policy Status** and Validity Dates **Coverage Limitations** (Maximum Visits, Exclusions) Service Cost (from E-Prescribing) and Contracted Rate Estimated Insurer Reimbursement Functionality Details: Policy/Member Eligibility Check: Allows Admin Staff to input the patient's Custom Insurance Member ID and instantly verify policy status (active/inactive) and applicable coverage limitations (e.g., maximum visits per year, covered services). Co-Payment/Billing Estimation: Based on the service provided (from the E-Prescribing module) and the verified custom policy coverage, the system calculates the estimated amount to be covered by the insurance and any remaining co-payment due from the patient.  |
| **Phase 3 System Roles and Access**  |
| **Super Admin (RHU Head / IT Lead)** |
| **Portal:** Super Admin Portal **Scope:** External Compliance, API Management, and Security Finalization **Capabilities:** API Configuration: Set up, configure, and monitor the status and sync schedules for DOH/eLMIS and Urbanwatch APIs.  Compliance Oversight: Configure PhilHealth validation rules and manage Digital/Electronic Signature security protocols. System Access: Manage security protocols and access logs for Telemedicine & Remote Access and the Patient Portal Access. DOH Program Configuration: Configure and maintain the Program-Specific Data Fields and templates for all DOH Programs. System Integration Monitoring: Monitor data flow and integrity of the new automated processes (E-Prescribing, PO generation). |
| **Admin (RHU Medical and GSO Staff – segmented roles)** |
| **Portal:** Admin Portal**Scope:** Task-oriented Read/Write access to automate workflows and utilize public health intelligence tools. **Capabilities: GSO Staff** (Inventory Focus) DOH/eLMIS API: Monitor Inventory data transmission status and confirm synchronization acknowledgments.  Urbanwatch: Provide real-time data on Available Medication Stock Summary (Critical Items) via the interface.  Mobile Integration: Use mobile devices for inventory counting and alerts. **Medical Staff** (Clinical Focus) E-Prescribing & Order Entry: Generate digital prescriptions/lab orders with automated Allergy/Interaction Checks.  DOH Program Forms: Access and complete program-specific forms based on patient diagnosis (e.g., TB Program forms).  PhilHealth Claims: Review and approve the Service Details and apply Digital/Electronic Signature before submission.  Telemedicine: Conduct basic consultations and securely access patient records via Telemedicine & Remote Access.  Mobile Integration: Use mobile devices for patient lookup and basic vital signs recording during outreach. **Administrative Staff** (Admin Focus)  PhilHealth Claims: Access the Claim Generation Interface, track List of Pending Claims; manage the Required Attachments Checklist, and handle the final Print/Export Claim Form Interface.  DOH/eLMIS API: Monitor the Data Sync Schedule/History; and use the Manual Trigger/Force Sync Button.  Patient Portal: Manage patient sign-up and password resets for Patient Portal Access. Appointment Scheduling: Full functionality to book, reschedule, and manage appointments using the Appointment Scheduling Calendar.  DOH Program Forms: Generate and Export program reports. Custom Insurance:  Input Custom Insurance Member ID to verify Policy/Member Eligibility (status, limitations).  Utilize Co-Payment/Billing Estimation based on services provided and insurance contracted rates. |

| Phase 4: System Optimization and Community Health |  |
| ----- | ----- |
| This module focuses on maintaining the system's long-term health, integrity, and security through advanced, automated protocols. |  |
| **Phase 3 System Overview** |  |
| **Module** | **Features** |
| Automated System Audits and Security Enhancements  | Security Dashboard, Audit Trail Log, Penetration Test Results Summary |
| Community Health Integration | Environmental Data Dashboard, Integrated View with Disease Surveillance Data, External Data Source Connection Status, Correlation Reports  |
| Mobile Integration | To provide convenience for RHU medical staff and GSO staff (e.g., patient lookup, alerts, basic vital signs recording, and inventory count) via a mobile device especially during outreach programs. |

| Automated System Audits and Security Enhancements |
| :---- |
| This module generates standardized, ready-to-submit PhilHealth claim forms using data captured during consultation and integrates digital signatures. Main Screen/Page Displays: Security Dashboard (System Health Status) Audit Trail Log (Filtered by User, Date, Action) Penetration Test Results Summary Each Audit Record Will Include: User ID and Role Timestamp of Action Action Performed (e.g., Record Viewed, Data Edited, Login Attempt) Data/Record Affected (e.g., Patient ID, Medicine Batch No.) Functionality Details: Automated Audit Trails: Introduces detailed, non-repudiable logs for every record access and data manipulation. Regular Penetration Testing: Automated or scheduled third-party testing to identify and patch security vulnerabilities. Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA): Enforces MFA for high-privilege users (e.g., RHU Head, Dalaguete Admin) to secure against unauthorized access.  |
| **Community Health Integration** |
| This module expands the system's scope beyond clinical data to include environmental factors that influence public health, enabling holistic analysis. Main Screen/Page Displays: Environmental Data Dashboard (Map/Graphs) Integrated View with Disease Surveillance Data External Data Source Connection Status Correlation Reports (e.g., Disease vs. Water Quality) Each Data Submission Record Includes: Data Type (e.g., Water Quality, Waste Management Statistics) Source (e.g., LGU Water Department, Waste Management) Geographic Point (Barangay/Zone) Data Value and Measurement Date Functionality Details: Data Integration: Integrates the system with local government programs to track environmental health factors (e.g., water quality, waste management statistics) that impact public health. Correlation Analysis: Allows the RHU to cross-reference disease outbreaks with local environmental issues for proactive public health intervention.  |
| **Mobile Integration** |
| Main Screen/Page Displays: Patient Lookup / Search Function Real-Time Alert Notifications (Low Stock, Outbreak) Inventory Count Interface Basic Vitals Recording Screen Task/Appointment Reminders Offline sync button Each Data Submission Record Includes: User ID and Role (Medical Staff or GSO Staff) Last Login Date/Time and Device ID Functionality Used (e.g., Patient Lookup, Stock Count) Geographic Location (GPS, if enabled/necessary for field work) Functionality Details: Convenience and Access: To provide essential system access (e.g., patient lookup, alerts, basic vital signs recording, and inventory count) via a mobile device especially during outreach programs. Field Data Capture: Enables Medical Staff to capture basic vital signs recording directly at the point of care in the field. Inventory Count: Allows GSO Staff to perform quick inventory count and stock verification remotely. Real-Time Alerts: Pushes real-time alerts (e.g., low stock, high-priority appointments, outbreak notifications) directly to the staff's mobile device. Offline Mode Capability: To consider areas with poor connectivity and allow users to record transactions offline and sync when connectivity is restored.  |
| **Phase 4 System Roles and Access**  |
| **Super Admin (RHU Head / IT Lead)** |
| **Portal:** Super Admin Portal **Scope:** System Security, Community Health Configuration, and Long-term Data Integrity **Capabilities:** Security Configuration (R/W): Configure and enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for high-privilege users (RHU Head, Dalaguete Admin). Audit Management: Access and review the Automated Audit Trails for record access and user actions. Security Oversight: Manage and approve outcomes from regular penetration testing. Environmental Data Integration (R/W): Set up and configure the integration with local government programs (e.g., LGU Water Department, Waste Management). Correlation Analysis: Utilize the Community Health Integration reports to analyze and guide public health strategy (e.g., Disease vs. Water Quality). |
